repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Also properly handles multiline tokens in `vim.lsp.semantic_tokens.get_at_pos()`

<!--
  Thank you for contributing to Neovim!
  If this is your first time, check out https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests-prs
  for our PR guidelines.
-->

comment_data.body: Seems like we already have an utility function for this: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/5f00e6adafebc7764c64496540bdd703e8a6a24e/runtime/lua/vim/lsp.lua#L81C14-L81C34
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -102,6 +104,7 @@ local function tokens_to_ranges(data, bufnr, client, request)
   local token_modifiers = legend.tokenModifiers
   local encoding = client.offset_encoding
   local lines = api.nvim_buf_get_lines(bufnr, 0, -1, false)
+  local line_ending = vim.bo.fileformat[bufnr] == 'dos' and '\r\n' or '\n'

comment_data.body: Just have a Lua table here :)
Not sure if we consider the addition of this field a breaking change. If so maybe we should make it optional?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2170,6 +2170,7 @@ get_at_pos({bufnr}, {row}, {col})
         fields:
         ‚Ä¢ line (integer) line number, 0-based
         ‚Ä¢ start_col (integer) start column, 0-based
+        ‚Ä¢ end_line (integer) end line number, 0-based

comment_data.body: Oh, thanks! I didn't know. I actually was thinking about this and I feel like it might just be better to add the char offset after `str_utfindex` rather than actually concatenating the string with the line ending, lmk what you think of this (I'll push a change)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -102,6 +104,7 @@ local function tokens_to_ranges(data, bufnr, client, request)
   local token_modifiers = legend.tokenModifiers
   local encoding = client.offset_encoding
   local lines = api.nvim_buf_get_lines(bufnr, 0, -1, false)
+  local line_ending = vim.bo.fileformat[bufnr] == 'dos' and '\r\n' or '\n'

comment_data.body: Note to self: most LSP tests use the `json_decode` style for getting a response, maybe most/all of these should be converted to tables to be consistent
Ah, good point. I could be wrong but I think usually new fields aren't considered breaking, just field renames/removals
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2170,6 +2170,7 @@ get_at_pos({bufnr}, {row}, {col})
         fields:
         ‚Ä¢ line (integer) line number, 0-based
         ‚Ä¢ start_col (integer) start column, 0-based
+        ‚Ä¢ end_line (integer) end line number, 0-based

comment_data.body: adding to a return value is non-breaking. `:help api-contract`
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2170,6 +2170,7 @@ get_at_pos({bufnr}, {row}, {col})
         fields:
         ‚Ä¢ line (integer) line number, 0-based
         ‚Ä¢ start_col (integer) start column, 0-based
+        ‚Ä¢ end_line (integer) end line number, 0-based

@@ -102,6 +104,7 @@ local function tokens_to_ranges(data, bufnr, client, request)
   local token_modifiers = legend.tokenModifiers
   local encoding = client.offset_encoding
   local lines = api.nvim_buf_get_lines(bufnr, 0, -1, false)
+  local line_ending = vim.bo.fileformat[bufnr] == 'dos' and '\r\n' or '\n'

comment_data.body: Agreed. Idk why we're writing raw JSON strings to deserialize them immediately after. No need to test `vim.fn.json_*` in all of our LSP tests üòÅ

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: feat(lsp): support multiline semantic tokens
